tutorial.title: Party raffle
tutorial.descriptionContent: Practice array methods by creating a lucky draw

executableContent.instructions:
It is Fana's birthday today. She plans to have a lucky name draw for guests attending the party! Let's help her by creating a program that picks a random name.

Let's start the name drawing by registering the people who came to the party! We will store the names in an array.

1. Create a `const` variable named `participants` and store an empty array in it, `[]`.

lessons.title: Store names of guest into array

executableContent.instructions:
These are the names of the people who are at the party, let's add their names to the array!
`"Ada"`, `"Bruce"`, `"Carlos"`, `"Dahlia"`, `"Eugene"`, `"Fana"`

1. Add all the names to the `participants` array using an array method, in the exact order listed above.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: You can add elements into the array with the array method `push()`. This can be done for each name or with all the names at once.

executableContent.instructions:
We want to check the participants to see if there are any names missing. There are a few ways to complete that task, but one simple way at this point is to print the participant name list.

1. In the console print `"Participants: "` and the `participants` array in one line.

lessons.title: Remove the last person from the array

executableContent.instructions:
We accidentally added Fana to the `participants` array. Let's remove her because she is the host, and the winner should be a guest!

1. Remove the last element of the `participants` array using an array method.
2. Print `"Participants: "` and the names from the `participants` array in the console to confirm that Fana is removed from our list.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: You can remove the last element in an array with the array method `pop()`.

executableContent.instructions:
Oh no, we mistook Chavo for his twin brother Carlos! Change the third element of the array from `"Carlos"` to `"Chavo"`.

1. Set the value of the third element of `participants` to `"Chavo"`.
2. Print `"Participants: "` and the names from the `participants` array in the console to confirm that `"Carlos"` is changed to `"Chavo"`.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Remember that arrays have indices that start from `0`. So to access the first element of our array we would use `participants[0]`.

lessons.title: Check the number of names in the array

executableContent.instructions:
It's almost time to spin the wheel and make the lucky name draw! One last time, let's check the participant pool and confirm the number of names in the `participants` array.

1. Display in the console the number of participants in the raffle. Use `"Number of participants in the raffle: "` followed by the number of elements in the `participants` array. Use a property of the `participants` variable to code this number.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: You can get the number of elements in an array using `array.length`

executableContent.instructions:
Great! We have 5 participants. Before we select a winner, let's check the names to confirm we've got everybody's name right. Previously we printed the participant name list as a whole, now let's print the names one by one using a loop!
We'll use a `for` loop to print all the names in the array line by line.

1. Create a for loop that loops through the array.
2. Print the element at the current index in the console.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
Here's how you can do a `for` loop:
```
for (let i = 0; i < participants.length; i++) {
  <code>
}
```
To print each element, just use `i` as the index.

executableContent.instructions:
Good work, now that we have confirmed the names, we need to find a random way to select a winner! Let's start by counting the number of characters in all participants' names. Use the `let` variable `namesCharacters` to store this value.

1. Assign the value `0` to the`namesCharacters` variable.
2. Inside the loop, add the length of each element in the `participants` array to the counter variable. Each iteration of the loop should add the current length to the previous counter total.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
You can access the length of each participant as follows:
```JavaScript
participants[i].length; (or whatever name you are using for the iterator variable in the loop)
```

lessons.title: Print the name of the lucky winner!

executableContent.instructions:
We've got the total number of characters from the names of the participants. Now, let's divide `namesCharacters` by the number of participants. We're going to use the remainder number from the division as the index of the `participants` array to tell us the lucky winner!

1. After the loop, create a `const` variable named `luckyIndex`.
2. Store the remainder of  `namesCharacters` *divided* by the length of `participants` in `luckyIndex`.
3. Print `"Congratulations "` and the name of the winner in the console, using the `participants` and `luckyIndex` variables.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: We can get a division remainder with `%`. For example `10 % 4 ` results in `2`, and `10 % 5` in `0`.
